issues.description: The template method `singFarmSongVerse` is declared without an `Animal` parameter, but the UML (problem statement) specifies `singFarmSongVerse(animal: Animal): void`, and the solution implements it with a parameter. Students will be unable to follow the intended design or compile the verse logic without adding this parameter.
issues.suggested_fix: In the template `Farm.java`, change the signature of `singFarmSongVerse` to accept an `Animal` parameter: `private void singFarmSongVerse(Animal animal) { ... }` so it matches the UML and the solution.

issues.description: The problem statement instructs students to use a `StringBuilder` for the `name` attribute in `Animal`, but both the UML diagram and the solution implementation use `String`. This discrepancy will confuse students about which type to implement.
issues.suggested_fix: Either revise the problem text and UML to specify `private String name` (removing the `StringBuilder` requirement), or update the solution (and UML) to use `private StringBuilder name` consistently, ensuring all getters, setters, and constructor parameters use `StringBuilder`.
